adjective.description: Of an oocyst or sporocyst of a coccidian: developing into a single sporozoite without division.
Of a tapeworm: not divided into proglottids, not segmented.

origin: Late 19th century (in an earlier sense). From mono- + -zoic. Compare scientific Latin Monozoa, former order and subclass name, French monozoïque, Portuguese monozóico.
